verses.verse: Moreover <S%H453>Elihu<s%> <S%H6030>answered,<s%>
<S%H8085>"Hear<s%> my <S%H4405>words,<s%> you <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H238>men.<s%> Give ear to <S%H3045>me,<s%> you who have knowledge.
For the <S%H241>ear<s%> <S%H974>tries<s%> <S%H4405>words,<s%> as the <S%H2441>palate<s%> <S%H2938>tastes<s%> <S%H398>food.<s%>
Let us <S%H977>choose<s%> for us that which is <S%H4941>right.<s%> Let us <S%H3045>know<s%> among ourselves what is <S%H2896>good.<s%>
For <S%H347>Job<s%> has <S%H559>said,<s%> <S%H6663><s%> 'I am righteous, <S%H410>God<s%> has taken <S%H5493>away<s%> my <S%H4941>right:<s%>
Notwithstanding my <S%H4941>right<s%> I am considered a <S%H3576>liar.<s%> My <S%H2671>wound<s%> is <S%H605>incurable,<s%> though I am without <S%H6588>disobedience.<s%>'
What <S%H1397>man<s%> is like <S%H347>Job,<s%> who <S%H8354>drinks<s%> <S%H3933>scorn<s%> like <S%H4325>water,<s%>
Who <S%H732>goes<s%> in <S%H2274>company<s%> with the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity,<s%> and <S%H3212>walks<s%> with <S%H7562>wicked<s%> <S%H582>men?<s%>
For he has <S%H559>said,<s%> <S%H5532><s%> 'It profits a <S%H1397>man<s%> nothing that he should <S%H7521>delight<s%> himself with <S%H430>God.<s%>'

"Therefore <S%H8085>listen<s%> to <S%H582>me,<s%> you men of <S%H3824>understanding:<s%> far be <S%H2486>it<s%> from <S%H410>God,<s%> that he should do <S%H7562>wickedness,<s%> from the <S%H7706>Almighty,<s%> that he should commit <S%H5766>iniquity.<s%>
For the <S%H6467>work<s%> of a <S%H120>man<s%> he will <S%H7999>render<s%> to <S%H376>him,<s%> and cause every man to <S%H4672>find<s%> according to his <S%H734>ways.<s%>
Yes <S%H551>surely,<s%> <S%H410>God<s%> will not do <S%H7561>wickedly,<s%> neither will the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> <S%H5791>pervert<s%> <S%H4941>justice.<s%>
Who put him in <S%H6485>charge<s%> of the <S%H776>earth?<s%> or who has <S%H7760>appointed<s%> him over the whole <S%H8398>world?<s%>
If he <S%H7760>set<s%> his <S%H3820>heart<s%> on <S%H622>himself,<s%> If he gathered to himself his <S%H7307>spirit<s%> and his <S%H5397>breath,<s%>
all <S%H1320>flesh<s%> would <S%H1478>perish<s%> <S%H3162>together,<s%> and <S%H120>man<s%> would turn <S%H7725>again<s%> to <S%H6083>dust.<s%>
"If now you have <S%H998>understanding,<s%> <S%H8085>hear<s%> <S%H238>this.<s%> Listen to the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H4405>words.<s%>
Shall even one who <S%H8130>hates<s%> <S%H4941>justice<s%> <S%H2280>govern?<s%> Will you <S%H7561>condemn<s%> him who is <S%H6662>righteous<s%> and <S%H3524>mighty?<s%>â€”
Who <S%H559>says<s%> to a <S%H4428>king,<s%> <S%H7563><s%> 'Vile!' or to <S%H5081>nobles,<s%> <S%H1100><s%> 'Wicked!'?

Who <S%H5375>doesn't<s%> respect the <S%H6440>persons<s%> of <S%H8269>princes,<s%> nor <S%H5234>respects<s%> the <S%H7771>rich<s%> more <S%H6440>than<s%> the <S%H1800>poor;<s%> for they all are the <S%H4639>work<s%> of his <S%H3027>hands.<s%>

In a <S%H7281>moment<s%> they <S%H4191>die,<s%> even at <S%H2676>midnight.<s%> The <S%H5971>people<s%> are <S%H1607>shaken<s%> and pass <S%H5674>away.<s%> The <S%H47>mighty<s%> are taken <S%H5674>away<s%> without a <S%H3027>hand.<s%>
"For his <S%H5869>eyes<s%> are on the <S%H1870>ways<s%> of a <S%H376>man.<s%> He <S%H7200>sees<s%> all his <S%H6806>goings.<s%>
There is no <S%H2822>darkness,<s%> nor thick <S%H6757>gloom,<s%> where the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity<s%> may hide <S%H5641>themselves.<s%>
For he <S%H7760>doesn't<s%> need to consider a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H1980>further,<s%> that he should go before <S%H410>God<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment.<s%>
He breaks in <S%H7489>pieces<s%> mighty <S%H3524>men<s%> in ways past <S%H2714>finding<s%> <S%H5975>out,<s%> and sets others in their <S%H312>place.<s%>
Therefore he takes <S%H5234>knowledge<s%> of their <S%H4566>works.<s%> He <S%H2015>overturns<s%> them in the <S%H3915>night,<s%> so that they are <S%H1792>destroyed.<s%>
He <S%H5606>strikes<s%> them <S%H8478>as<s%> wicked <S%H7563>men<s%> in the <S%H4725>open<s%> sight of <S%H7200>others;<s%>
because they turned <S%H5493>aside<s%> from following <S%H310>him,<s%> and <S%H7919>wouldn't<s%> pay attention to any of his <S%H1870>ways,<s%>
so that they caused the <S%H6818>cry<s%> of the <S%H1800>poor<s%> to <S%H935>come<s%> to <S%H8085>him.<s%> He heard the <S%H6818>cry<s%> of the <S%H6041>afflicted.<s%>

When he gives <S%H8252>quietness,<s%> who then can <S%H7561>condemn?<s%> When he <S%H5641>hides<s%> his <S%H6440>face,<s%> who then can <S%H7789>see<s%> <S%H1471>him?<s%> Alike whether to a nation, or to <S%H3162>a<s%> <S%H120>man,<s%>
that the <S%H120>godless<s%> man may not <S%H4427>reign,<s%> that there be no one to <S%H4170>ensnare<s%> the <S%H5971>people.<s%>
"For has any <S%H559>said<s%> to <S%H410>God,<s%> <S%H5375><s%> 'I am guilty, but I will not offend any <S%H2254>more.<s%>
<S%H3384>Teach<s%> me that which I <S%H1107>don't<s%> <S%H2372>see.<s%> If I have <S%H6466>done<s%> <S%H5766>iniquity,<s%> I will do it no <S%H3254>more<s%>'?
Shall his <S%H7999>recompense<s%> be as you <S%H3588>desire,<s%> that you refuse <S%H977>it?<s%> For you must choose, and not <S%H1696>I.<s%> Therefore speak what you <S%H3045>know.<s%>
<S%H582>Men<s%> of <S%H3824>understanding<s%> will <S%H559>tell<s%> <S%H2450>me,<s%> yes, every wise <S%H1397>man<s%> who hears <S%H8085>me:<s%>
<S%H347><s%> 'Job <S%H1696>speaks<s%> without <S%H1847>knowledge.<s%> His <S%H1697>words<s%> are without <S%H7919>wisdom.<s%>'
I <S%H15>wish<s%> <S%H347>that<s%> were <S%H974>tried<s%> to the <S%H5331>end,<s%> because of his <S%H8666>answering<s%> like <S%H205>wicked<s%> <S%H582>men.<s%>
For he <S%H3254>adds<s%> <S%H6588>rebellion<s%> to his <S%H2403>sin.<s%> He <S%H5606>claps<s%> his hands among <S%H7235>us,<s%> and multiplies his <S%H561>words<s%> against <S%H410>God.<s%>"
